website_summaries.verdict: Excellent picture quality for 4K video with a quad-core processor for fast streaming speed.
pros: Micro SD port offers extra storage
Sound transitions smoothly from TV to headphones when listening privately
cons: Doesn't have gaming buttons on remote
If overheating becomes an issue, it can periodically freeze

website_summaries.verdict: For 4K HDR TV owners fed up of using built-in smart TV apps, the Roku Premiere+ is my top pick.
pros: The Roku Premiere+ can access more TV shows and movies in 4K and HDR than most rival devices
It has better features for the money than Roku's other 4K streamers, and unlike the Chromecast Ultra it actually includes a remote (and an Amazon Video app)
Roku's ecosystem offers more apps, better search and more customization than any other
cons: Content in 4K and HDR is still uncommon, and your HDR TV probably already has compatible apps
Unlike some of those TVs, Premiere+ doesn't work with with Dolby Vision HDR
There's no voice capability on the remote
Some app interfaces are less polished than on rival devices

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Roku Premiere+ (it replaced a Roku 3)
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Roku Premiere+ (it replaced a Roku 3), and I'd give it 5 stars if it weren't for the audio sync problem that others have mentioned. The problem occurs on all 4K video (which is pretty spectacular otherwise) on Amazon Video, Netflix and HBO. With manual lip sync on my Yamaha receiver, I've been able to make the problem tolerable (again,as another reviewer mentioned), but it varies from source to source, so is never totally "right." Like the others, I wish Roku would come up with a fix. I really like the unit, but this problem is a major flaw in an otherwise nice device.
customer_reviews.author: sdbart

customer_reviews.title: the roku 3 is overall the best model ive used and if you dont have a ...
customer_reviews.text: dont know about anyone else but i had my roku premiere+ for a few months now and it keeps freezing up and restarting every so often. i dont know if the cause for this is over heating or not but for a 4k device its ok. the roku 3 is overall the best model ive used and if you dont have a 4k tv just go with the 3. i had picked this one over the one one with the fan seeing how may people complain on the fan failure and noise hope this help anyone considering this model
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but it needs work by Roku
customer_reviews.text: I do like the product. I upgraded from a Roku 3 after buying a 4k TV. Easy to setup. Great content availability. But it has lip sync issues. This is something Roku needs to fix soon. There is a work around though. Change the audio out from 'DolbyD/DTS' to 'DolbyD'. That seemed to solve the issue for me. I would like my DTS audio back. Roku needs to update firmware to fix this problem. If they fix this, I will move this up to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Headphones feature is nice but sometimes it can have static and random noise ...
customer_reviews.text: Headphones feature is nice but sometimes it can have static and random noise and the only way to fix it is to restart app. Hulu app takes a long time to load thumbnails of titles. Other than that it streams every thing okay... For the money the Amazon prime stick is better. The only feature that makes this worth while is the headset.
customer_reviews.author: J. McAllister

customer_reviews.title: DTS audio out of sync - go buy a roku 3 instead
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 roku devices, and was hoping to make this model my 5th. Unfortunately, there exists a bug in the current FW which causes the audio to be out of sync when playing DTS audio output to a compatible receiver. Roku has publicly acknowledge the existence of this bug in their forums, but there is currently no ETA on when the fix will arrive. 7.5.1 was supposed to fix the issue, but unfortunately for me it did not. Until this bug is fixed, I am giving this product a 1 star review. TL;DR buy a Roku 3 or 4. They are rock solid, this and the ultra are not.
customer_reviews.author: hollanbm

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy any Roku newer than Roku 3 if planning to use a receiver and Dolby Digital +
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this or any Roku newer than a Roku 3 if you're planning to use a receiver with a Dolby Digital + audio source such as Netflix or other apps supporting Dolby+ and an HDMI connection. There are varying levels of audio sync lag depending on app used. To date Roku has no fix. No sync issues if audio forced to Dolby/DTS on Roku but then only stereo for Amazon, Netflix apps using my Yamaha receiver. This is an ongoing complaint on Roku's forums with no resolution yet. No issues using the same apps with a Roku 3.
customer_reviews.author: dbet

customer_reviews.title: Poor service
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. It stopped working and I can't get the help needed to get it back working. Roku responded to my request for status after a 2-week wait: It shows that the ticket created for you was escalated to our concerned team for further investigation. It was escalated 11/24 but still under investigation. I am afraid, they haven't provided any feedback yet because perhaps no resolutions nor workaround available yet. When I said that was unacceptable the answer was: I understand. I am afraid, we don't have time frame for escalated cases. That depends on when the concerned team will send feedback.
customer_reviews.author: carol ann

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is this series of Rokus or the two that I received. These things are horrible, I have to reset it every few hours because it freezes. Also some times I get this weird color loss(I've attached a photo!) I'll admit the picture is great on my Samsung when it is working. Also the handshake issue is a problem as well for the UHD... I wish I would have purchased from Roku that way I could keep getting them to send me a new one until I got some that worked properly!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Roku failure.
customer_reviews.text: I had faith in Roku, until this. I thought to myself how bad could it really be? Well, I hate this thing. I have to restart it every day. Gone are the days when you could just turn in your Roku and search for something. Now I get one of the following.... HDCP error with 4k hdr. Flickering screen. People turn blue. No sound. Picture but my avr states there is no video signal. These are just a few off the top of my head. It's awful. I'm switching to an Amazon fire. It's a shame Roku had it right with the 3. Oh and one more minus, let me have two audio outputs please.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Beware connection issues after update
customer_reviews.text: I own a brand new LG 4K 60 hz TV and I consistently have connection issues since the last firmware "upgrade". A purple screen flashes every 10 seconds or so unless you dial the quality down to 1080p, which you know, defeats the purpose of buying a 4K quality streaming device. I bought new cables just for this so that's not the problem either. Rather than admitting they promoted a faulty update, Roku points the finger back at their customers blaming your cord or your TV for not being compatible. I used it without issue for roughly 10 months and now I can't use it for anything. Absolutely a waste money. Will now have to buy a different device.
customer_reviews.author: SpinSTL

customer_reviews.title: Audio Drops Still Not Patched. Rubbish Product.
customer_reviews.text: Audio cuts out every 4-6 minutes. No "fix" has worked on my unit, even rebooting before watching. The issue is not with the rest of my hardware. Many others have this issue yet it is still not patched out. My first and last Roku product. Buy a Shield over this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Big_B

customer_reviews.title: This unit produces a horrible Popping sound through the speakers that I worry could ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit produces a horrible Popping sound through the speakers that I worry could cause permanent damage. Roku support essentially won’t admit there is a problem, even though it’s widely known across the Internet. Though they have to be aware of this problem, they take you through a dog and pony show of unplugging this and restarting that, none of which actually addresses the issue. Apparently they never instituted the proper updates needed to handle this issue. I have an order in for the fire cube or whatever it’s called. Roku has a good interface but this is an unacceptable problem for a new device.
customer_reviews.author: Elektrodread

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Media Player
customer_reviews.text: Needed for 4K TV and RF remote. Common simple and easy to use Roku interface and the only complaint I have is the occasional freezing and restart of its operating system. I've owned most Roku models and even though this is 802.11ac on my dedicated 5ghz ac network it doesn't seem to perform any faster (navigation or loading of content) or slower than Roku's latest quad core streaming stick. If it wasn't for the sale price and 4k tv I'd suggest folks opt for the stick to save money and potentially avoid as many freezing issues.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Beats The Ultra Hands Down
customer_reviews.text: This is the 'old school' Premiere+ 4630R. There's not many left around. It has the earphone jack and ear buds are supplied. Roku dumbed-down this model. The new Premiere+ is less than half its size and no earphone jack. Also, it doesn't have a decent 4K HD screensaver like the 4630R, the best you can do is 'floating bubbles'! I already had a 4630R in another room and I bought this to replace an Ultra. Roku wants to push the Ultra which has an excellent Aquarium 4K HD screensaver but the lag time for button response is atrocious. I made several attempts to contact Roku about this and never got a response. I wound up giving my Ultra away.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work right out of the box, support wasn't helpful
customer_reviews.text: I had audio/video sync issues with this on multiple channels. I spent two weeks trying to get help from Roku support, they told me that version 7.6 of the firmware was out and would at some point get installed on my unit, but couldn't tell me when that would happen. As I didn't have any guarantee that 7.6 would definitely fix the problem I decided to cut my losses and return this.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: General quality issues or lemon?
customer_reviews.text: Lasted only 4 months before failure, nothing will display after boot, factory reset did not fix. I have owned Roku's since they first came out, and this new one has been a bit flakey from the start. I personally see a drop in quality, or perhaps Amazon is sending out the lemons as I had always purchased directly from Roku. Who knows, but this kind of failure is unheard of these days. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: DLAVL

customer_reviews.title: Good device, poor quality remote
customer_reviews.text: Good device, poor quality remote. The roku itself is great, sooo much nicer than the old roku 2 we had. The remote has a headphone jack which is very nice to use for those late at night movies. Unfortunately we dropped it a few times, but drops are bound to happen and should be survivable. In our case, a large surface mount resistor fell off the remote's circuit board and now it does not work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J

customer_reviews.title: Sound Issue but much faster then the old ones.
customer_reviews.text: Works just like any other Roku however we have already had an issue with sound cutting in and out especially when we are watching Netflix. I am unsure if this is because of the app version of Netflix or the Roku itself. Besides this issue this Roku is much faster then the Roku and Roku streaming stick which i own both. I really love the feature of hooking headphones into the remote as well for quiet listening. As far as 4K there is not enough content to make this Roku worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Justine A.

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming, money saving, cord-cutting device purchase EVER!
customer_reviews.text: The Roku Premiere + makes cutting the cord from Comcast a sweet, cheap, easy, exhillerating liberation! If it had lips I'd kiss it. We use Pandora, Netflix and Amazon Prime to stream. These connected flawlessly. BUT I didn't realize that there are so many free channel options like live network news, sports and programming channels too. The search is the best: easily enter the show or movie you want and Roku shows you all the different channels where it's available and the cost. So a one-time device purchase of less than $80 vs $1500 a year to Concrust/Extortery cable. No brainer. (And I bought my own and wrote this over-the-top positive review without compensation)
customer_reviews.author: smack

customer_reviews.title: Good video; iffy sound
customer_reviews.text: My old Roku had grown sufficiently long in the tooth that most apps were no longer updating. The last straw was when I couldn't watch NHL.TV, this season. So, I popped for a new device. Video quality's good. The menus are refreshed. The sound quality is *REALLY* harsh - it's like the sound is being radically-compressed, wiping out the range and just making it very raspy and hard on the ears. Compared to the sound from my XBone and other devices - which all deliver broad-range sound with accoustic-depth, this device just *really* sucks for listening to. Glad it's my backup streaming device and not my primary.
customer_reviews.author: ferricoxide

customer_reviews.title: Roku Premiere + HD
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this unit from the Roku 2XS. This unit has 802.11AC, which makes wifi streaming so much better! I like the ability to listen to shows using the Roku headphones (the headphones, which seem to be of excellent quality, plug right into the Roku remote, so you are not tethered to the TV or Roku box). You can use any 1/8' headphones with this. The remote is nicely designed. If you are upgrading or want to try the Roku streaming environment (Netflix, Amazon Prime, MLB Sports, ...), then this is would be a terrific purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wyrmwood

customer_reviews.title: Freezing up and rebooting by itself often enough to be annoying
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of devices for streaming, Apple TV, Roku, ps4, Xbox, Wii, Kodi, Amazon stick, bluray players... Roku in general is the most user friendly and quicker access compared to the others. I have the Roku 4k Ultra model and it's the worst of all because of the overheat problem. This step down Roku Premiere model is a little better but it still has the problem with freezing up or rebooting by itself often enough to be annoying. Hopefully they will straighten things out in the next mode otherwise I'll have to look at different alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: AZshopper

customer_reviews.title: I was shipped a different model than described
customer_reviews.text: The Roku described is Model 4630R which includes a MicroSD card and an Ethernet port. What was actually shipped to me was Model 3921 (which has no MicroSD slot, no Ethernet port, and no headphones). Unfortunately, Roku has used the same name & branding (Premiere+) for multiple Models. Be very careful to check that you receive the model that is listed.
customer_reviews.author: mfleck

customer_reviews.title: Everything I need for a complete streaming experience
customer_reviews.text: This is all that's required for a complete streaming system. I use this device on a 1080p television, and it works perfectly. I purchased this model because I could connect it via cat5 cable, rather than rely on wifi. This gives me both speed and security, making it worth the extra $15. I also like the ability to work the volume on the remote, as well as plug in a set of headphones. I imagine that if I purchase a 4k tv in the future, having a wired connection would be essential to stream.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gallant

customer_reviews.title: Roku premiere media player
customer_reviews.text: This is an update to my earlier review: This is my 4th Roku devise and I am very satisfied with the easy install and performance of this product. Roku delivers many web programs that installs with ease. I recommend this model because you can hard wire with Ethernet cable. I have had some issues with my internet provider witch causing too much buffering and disconnecting. Be aware that they are shipping a different item that does not connect to ethernet. This device comes in two different styles. Amazon has sent me one correct item and two wrong items. Gave up and ordered the roku ultra item which can connect with ethernet cable.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Like it, but the remote does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: I like the product itself, but about two weeks after hooking it up the remote stopped working. I changed batteries and it began working again, but the earphones do not work. I have replaced the batteries at least six times and after week or so, it stops working again. If I do get the earphones to work sporadically, they stop working after about 10 minutes. I purchased this product specifically so I could use the earphones and not bother others with the noise of the TV, so not working like I had planned.
customer_reviews.author: largo6125

customer_reviews.title: Does not support Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: I’m not really sure what to say - it’s obviously a Premiere+ as it says so on the box, but this product is not what is pictured. No headphones, and it does not support Ethernet. We purchased it specifically because we need Ethernet. I don’t trust roku enough to reorder it online as this doesn’t make any sense.
customer_reviews.author: A girl just trying to help

customer_reviews.title: Required Software Update Bricks Device Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a variety of Roku devices over the years, and attempted to upgrade to the Premiere+. On initial setup, a software update is required, and the device reboots - never to connect to the network again (via Ethernet or WiFi). Two separate brand new devices had an identical issue and Roku support didn't have an explanation for it. I upgraded to an Ultra rather than try a third time and it worked the first time, like the other 4 Rokus I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Requires reboots every few days.
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 other Roku devices and I always happy with their performance. After using the Roku Premiere device for 3 months, I would be happy with the ease of use and quality of picture, but recently it has been failing and requiring constant reboots. Every few days, I have to unplug the power and start it again because I am not getting any signal to the TV. It is using a wired connection and I checked the firmware and it is up to date. If I find a solution from the vendor I may change my rating, but at this point I am disappointed with the need for reboots.
customer_reviews.author: Global

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit
customer_reviews.text: Before you install the Roku device, do yourself a favor and create a Roku account online, makes activation so much simpler. Great picture quality, faster and a better UI (user interface) than my older Panasonic Blu-Ray disc player. Gripes are small, not backlight, no audio control when using HDMI through AV receiver, the "hot" buttons for some services are a nuisance if not subscribed. With the $20 markdown from regular price was a no brainer to buy.
customer_reviews.author: m3m0ryleak

customer_reviews.title: My first Roku.
customer_reviews.text: This is my FIRST ever Roku. I gave my mom my FireTV stick and decided to give the Roku a chance. I am not disappointed at all! Streaming is fast, smooth and consistent. DirectTV now was a HUGE pain on the FTV Stick but with the Roku Premier +, NO ISSUES! Getting around and finding the app you want to use is SIMPLE and it loads up fairly quick. It doesn't have a lot of apps like other devices but it has the basics. Netflix, Amazon Video, HULU, Sling TV, DirectTV Now, HBO Go, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: The experience is good overall - the interface is snappy
customer_reviews.text: The experience is good overall - the interface is snappy, it provides just about everything you could ever want, it's fast and decent quality. Wifi control with Harmony remotes is also nice. That said, it will distort commercials on Hulu when streaming 4:3 shows like Golden Girls. It's also got a clunky UI. I bought this as an upgrade from an Apple TV 3 and my wife and I are 50/50 on whether we want to keep it, because of the usability issues. The Apple TV has some annoying limitations (like no Amazon video) but the UI is years ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Conroy

customer_reviews.title: Short Life Span
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a year. I purchased this when I got a message from Roku saying they were no longer going to update the Roku I purchased in 2005. When this new one quit working I plugged in the 2005 model and it works. I always liked the chunky little remote that came with it. Amazon and Netflick still worked with it so I'm good. I have also purchased 6 Roku sticks and they all still work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Here is hint. To really make use of the AC chip you need the Roku to see 5Ghz channels, which it may not do out of the box. You will need to go into your router setting and adjust 5Ghz from 80hz to 40hz. Super easy to do, and once done you can enjoy the speed you bought this thing for. if don't then you are only using standard N speeds and bandwidth. The upgraded iphone functionality is a nice feature.from the Roku 3.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: When setting up the only help I found was those "opportunistic" 3rd party support places who wanted $60 to help me set up Roku. They promoted themselves as theonly way of getting extra channels etc. I told them that I already had that included and was not paying them. I almost sent it back because of them until one of them gave me the phone number for Roku which helped me. It turned out Excellent, it is my favorite streaming device along with TIVO Roamio (but only with the most incredible antenna I found ... ANTOP model # AT-400BV digital antenna which I also purchased from amazon). they are both equally amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Fast and responsive. Great picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Roku to replace my Roku express and wow am I satisfied. The picture quality is great obviously you need a 4k TV and 4k capable HDMI cable and 4k content to really appreciate it. The Roku is really fast while browsing through movies and shows . The remote is great, it's point anywhere so you can place the box anywhere you want. The best feature is private listening with the remote. The sound never cuts out and the quality is great as well. I highly recommend it. I love this Roku I will buy more later for my other TVs.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Asuncion

customer_reviews.title: i wasn't happy with it from the beginning
customer_reviews.text: defective after 6 weeks. i wasn't happy with it from the beginning. i was always having to reboot. sound would cut out inconsistently. now it wont display on the left panel of my tv . i tested both the cable and tv by plugging in the old roku, and also a ps4. both worked fine. i have been using roku from the beginning, looks like i'll give apple tv a try.
customer_reviews.author: tlod0813

customer_reviews.title: Works smoothly, has everything, and cross-platform search saves me money.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was no problem for me. It worked smoothly from the start and had all the channels (esp. Netlfix, Amazon, Google Play, HBO) that I wanted. Since the remote doesn't need line-of-sight, I can just stash the unit under and behind the TV. The cross-platform search in particular deserves special mention. It's really easy to search for what you want to watch, and Roku tells you the prices from major content providers, allowing you to see the cheapest option. (For example, you see if something is free on Netflix, but you would have to pay for it on Amazon or Google Play.) With this feature alone, my purchase will probably pay for itself within a year.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the best version of Roku
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from my old "Roku 2" to a TV-integrated Roku and didn't notice much of a difference other than the profiles. Upgraded to this device and whoa, what a difference in speed. No more waiting forever to scroll or lagging response while typing - even the pictures/movie covers pop-up quicker. So much nicer!!! And, not having to point directly at the device is a huge perk that I didn't even realize I would love.
customer_reviews.author: MartinV

customer_reviews.title: decent box when price is right
customer_reviews.text: Decent box, Not so decent price ever since the roku ultra had bad sales. Went up over 30$ just because it was outselling the new boxes. Lacks the usb port of the ultra model Has ethernet which is a HUGE PRO even though roku is reliable as far as wifi goes if your router is decent. Would have grabbed another but no way at this price, just grab the cheap models for now until they sort out this pricing mess
customer_reviews.author: brett

customer_reviews.title: This is probably my 6th Roku and if it wasn't ...
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my 6th Roku and if it wasn't for the HDCP errors every time I watch something in 4K, I would have given it five stars. This is ridiculous. I even bought a brand new HDMI cable. Every time a show starts, it pops up with the HDCP unauthorized and I have to get up, go unplug it, and plug it back in. The TV is a new 2016 model Samsung 9000 series. It has a hub for 4 HDMI ports, all of which are supposed to be HDCP 2.2 compliant. Roku needs to get with Samsung and figure this out or provide an over the air update to remove the broken "feature"
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We've tried Apple TV, Amazon Firestick, and a Roku has been our favorite by far. The system just seems more robust and cleaner, and we've not had any issues with it to report now for 3 months so far. We're cable free in our household, so the Roku is our main source of media entertainment in the evenings when we're home. There's plenty of apps to choose from, and something for everyone in the family. This has probably been the best purchase of the year for us!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loved it until update 9.0 destroyed the who product.
customer_reviews.text: The best feature was the night listening mode which would adjust noises so action scenes were not so deafening and dialog was louder and easier to hear. Single best thing ever for those late nights when you don't want to shock kids or other awake when an explosion hits... The most recent update removed this feature from any device that isn't a brand new more expensive one. I only bought this Roku for this specific feature! Literally I only use it because of that feature! Stupid Roku unnecessarily alienating customers. I used to recommend it to everybody I knew not I will champion anything other than Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk - Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Loved my Roku at first, easy to use and simple interface, but right around the time the warranty expires, this piece of junk shows its true colors. Audio intermittent, picture washed out and splits into two (doubled home screen), and random warnings that pop up with no rhyme or reason. Tried on two different TVs and also tried Chromecast and Fire Stick, so I know the Roku is the problem. If you do take a gamble, make sure to get a protection plan. I neglected to and now I'm really regretting it.
customer_reviews.author: KMK

customer_reviews.title: Go Roku
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Roku for 2 years now and love the ability to watch what I like when I like -- especially all the episodes of my favorite shows. I binge watch many of my favorites and Roku makes that easy. For some reason, my original Roku stopped working so I purchased the Premiere+ and am very pleased with the features, especially having the "ok" button in the middle of the stick making it much easier to access shows. If I didn't have a cable contract, I would cancel it altogether, and plan to do so when I can -- I simply don't watch regular TV anymore since Roku gives me everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Davis

customer_reviews.title: chat room pop-up offering to activate your account they will try to SCAM you out of $69.99
customer_reviews.text: The Roku works fine, just be aware while at the Roku website during activation that if you get that annoying chat room pop-up offering to activate your account they will try to SCAM you out of ($69.99 for a one time activation fee and the latest firmware) very persistent buggers..they make it sound that the $69.99 is required for set up. WHICH IS BS I’m surprised they didn’t want to help with my taxes or cash a check from a Indian princess.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed-shd have got the stick
customer_reviews.text: Love the point anywhere remote. No probelms or delays with buffering. Basically works great. However I mostly got this instead of the stick because of the function which is supposed to make loud sounds quieter and quiet sounds (like whispers) louder. (I live with my 80 year old father and the blasts of noise from action flicks and hystrionic sports announcers carry through the house) Very disappointed that the effect is so subtle as to make no noticeable difference to me-and it actually raises the overall volume when function is selected. Since he doesn't want to use the earbuds I should have just ordered the newest roku stick and saved the money.
customer_reviews.author: AZ 3

customer_reviews.title: Need Settings Help!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this product for a while now and I do not understand why it does not automatically change the setting from 4K to 1080 if the show doesn't not meet the 4k standards. I have to manually change the settings because an annoying display appears when the image is 1080. Clearly I must being something incorrectly so if anyone knows why I get that pop up to change my video settings, it would be greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Streaming at last!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first foray into the world of streaming TV. I got the Premiere+ because I wanted to used the wired LAN connection instead of wi-fi. Installation and hook-up was quite easy. I also got the Totalmount Roku holder for mounting the Roku on the back of the TV. Once installed, setting up a Roku account was also quite easy. We've watched several movies already and the device seems to work just as it should.
customer_reviews.author: WxToad

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little hot and more!
customer_reviews.text: The only negative is it runs hot. Other than that. A great buy! I've had this now for a few months and this is NOT an improvement from the two! I believe the two is by far the best ROKU unit this far. This premeire+ has started shutting down, restarting and freezing all in its own. I was hoping this would be a step up. I'm still going give this more time.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Technologically Advanced Device ....Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great device. It has some perks that the lower cost streaming devices don't have. For example, headphone port for private listening. (Note for manufacturer...Please add greater range to volume control.) It also superbly supports 4K resolution. One major drawback is that this advanced model, doesn't have a "captions on & off" capacity like the lower models have. (For those that complain that it doesn't work as well after a few weeks, my non-technical wife gave me a solution that the Roku website could not. Decrease the size of your watchlists, and your Roku will work more smoothly.)
customer_reviews.author: Elton Malkia

customer_reviews.title: More Space...
customer_reviews.text: The Roku Premiere is a great box, however, the internal storage is lacking. Even with 64 gig micro SD card, the channel threshold is small. Example; adding Sling TV will require a lot of space, that and Amazon, so when you try and add new channels a Roku alert will pop up saying that I need to delete other channels to add a new one. If Roku wants to improve there Premier+ then they need to incorporate hardware that allows for more channels and apps. Other than that I am satisfied with the box.
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: A wired connection is ALWAYS the best connection, when possible
customer_reviews.text: I've bought lots of Roku's. Just got another one for the the 4K TV. It came with extensive apps including Netflix and Amazon buttons. But, I just cut the cable. There are still free Roku channels that even my fancy TV doesn't have (BBC America). I am able to hook this one up via ethernet directly to my router. A wired connection is ALWAYS the best connection, when possible. My upstairs Rokus don't have this going for them, but they still seem to stream very well. I don't know how much longer something like a Roku box will be relevant, but for now, they are.
customer_reviews.author: arrowspace

customer_reviews.title: Buy one, and save money
customer_reviews.text: Started streaming a couple of years ago. This is an upgrade for better 4K picture quality. If you are still paying for cable or satellite service... WHY??? Get a Roku, there are thousands of channels you can watch for free, some are better than others. Amazon Prime membership provide you with Amazon Prime Video. There are thousands of programs to watch. Then there are the other premium paid service such as Netflix, Hulu and others. We went from trying to find something to watch on our 500 channel satellite service, to try to decide which show to watch, because we have so many choices. And we are saving over a $100 a month
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Voice Search as an upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had done my homework better when I made my selection. I couldn't see much difference, other than $30, between the Premiere+ and the Ultra since they both came with an "enhanced" remote and had great reviewed picture quality. When the Premiere+ arrived; I was disappointed to see that the included "enhanced" remote did not have Voice Search as other "enhanced" remotes. I called Roku and was told that they would sell me an "enhanced" remote with Voice Search for $30 that would work with the Premiere+. I now have a Premiere+ with Voice Search and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: In today's economy, cable companies are pricing themselves right out of business. This is a great product in "cutting the cord". I've had mine for a few months now and very satisfied. I am on a tight budget and can't afford to have one for each room, but it's not a hassle to unplug and change rooms. If you've been doing traditional cable, it takes a little adjusting, but you will adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still a great streaming video unit.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced our older Roku which has moved to a secondary TV. Aside from the more grip-able remote (this one is slightly rubbery feel), we couldn't tell any difference between this and the older one as we don't have 4K or HDR televisions. I bought this one as a replacement since it had an RJ45 Ethernet jack and the Bluetooth remote, but I could have gone to a slightly "lesser" model if I didn't feel the need for them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Linder

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't disappoint
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for an eight year old Roku that just decided to stop working. I went with Roku again because my previous lasted a long time and until the end, gave me no issues. The set up was extremely easy and went very smoothly. My husband likes using voice recognition and said it works well( I don't use it). It works well and I hope this one lasts as long or longer than my last one.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic media player, beware of HDMI 2.2 though...
customer_reviews.text: Device is very responsive compared to the older models. Boot time, loading of apps, launching shows, etc. The remote has been greatly improved too. Finally don't have to point it directly at the roku anymore! The only thing you need to be aware of is if you are wanting to stream 4K through a receiver you have to make sure your receiver has HDMI 2.2. There is new content protection in HDMI 2.2 that prevents content to stream in 4K through devices that are not HDMI 2.2 certified. You can always bypass your receiver and do optical out as an alternative, but something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Reese

customer_reviews.title: I love this Roku
customer_reviews.text: The upgrades to Roku are wonderful. It has been several years since I purchased a new one, and boy am I surprised. This version is greased lightning compared to my old one. I am very glad that I spent the money and upgraded. Might consider replacing 2 more old Roku devices.
customer_reviews.author: autumnrose

customer_reviews.title: Breathtaking 4k UHD/HDR streaming device
customer_reviews.text: We love Roku. Recent 4k tv purchase made getting the Roku Premier + a must sinCe it supports 4k. We have had rokus in the house since 2013. They become obsolete before they die since out of the 6 we own, none have ever died. A top notch product.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Roku is a pain
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this Roku box for access to content, as I thought it would provide added value over the native content in my smart TV. But the result was just the opposite. For the channels that I use the most (YouTube, Netflix), I had to deal with numerous quality issues such as formatting problems, dropped audio and/or video or flat out unavailability of content. I finally disconnected my Roku box and switched to my smart TV's built-in streaming capabilities, after which quality and reliability of the above mentioned channels improved dramatically. Moral of the story - Roku is not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Paul V.

customer_reviews.title: I expected better performance, not worse
customer_reviews.text: I expected better performance, not worse. I have a couple of Roku 3, and they are better performers. This Premiere+ requires a daily restart to run well - I stream Sling as my primary TV service. After a day of Sling streaming, the Premiere+ is lethargic, meaning responses to the remote are slow. It appears to be some sort of memory issue. Unless you have 4K and NEED 4K, I would avoid this unit and go to the Roku 3 - this does work, so that's the 3-start "It's OK", just OK.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Picture Quality is Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality on this new Roku is truly excellent! I was using a Netflix app built into the smart TV which was good but it was 10X better when I switched to watching Netflix on the same TV through the Roku. The picture quality was instantly better. The load time was a lot quicker and the sound was better (I had to lower the volume because the sound was so clear through the Roku, we didn't need the extra volume). Plus the Roku interface is really awesome, easy to use and navigate. You can tons of apps now (HBO, Nat Geo, Fox, CBS, Sports, Movies). Highly, highly recommend for new users and anyone wanting to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Dows

customer_reviews.title: Buggy and Somewhat disappointing Roku Unit
customer_reviews.text: I had an early edition of the stick Roku and it worked great--until it stopped working. I ordered this Premiere+HD and 4K streaming media, which I now know was overkill for my needs. First issue was that the voice/video was not synced. Next I wanted to use the earphones that plug into the remote control. Once I plugged in the earphones, The Roku no longer worked. I researched on the web and got a solution to fix the problem butI cannot use the earphones. I wish I had purchased a less sophisticated Roku unit.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Howell

customer_reviews.title: Terrible device terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: This device constantly shorts out while watching it. I sent off for a new one and it came. It does the exact same thing. I returned the old device and it was a pain in the ass had to call someone for an email and sent it off. Now almost a month later got charged for the original device anyway. I’m furious. Out of work due to corona virus and being charged for devices I don’t have in my possession.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but watch out for the short warranty!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased mine in 2017. After only a year, it started having connectivity glitches. Short disconnections from wifi. I tried in another room, and have experienced the same problem. Nothing to do but buy something else. Sad about the short warranty period!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!  No support or returns for defects!
customer_reviews.text: Warranty is supposed to be a year, but roku won’t honor it because I didn’t purchase from their website. The thing broke, gives countless error codes and neither amazon or roku will take a return to replace it. I’ve used roku a for YEARS. I have tried every fix, it just doesn’t work. Won’t put any more money into roku a after this- do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steffany

customer_reviews.title: Great for watching in the evening while my husband sleeps
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying our new Roku Premiere. >>BEST<< feature is a small upgrade available in the remote that allows use of headphones!! Great for watching in the evening while my husband sleeps. The remote takes 2 AA batteries. there's an icon that pops up on the welcome screen that tells you the remaining charge on the batteries. I did discover that it's necessary to unplug the head phones from the remote when not in use. I left them plugged in one night and the batteries were dead in the AM.
customer_reviews.author: Gail C. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the Premier+
customer_reviews.text: Added this Premier+ to a 4K-UHD LG TV in our girls room. While that is a very smart TV, it's limited in the channels we can stream. Honestly, the Roku picture looks great. Set up requires some patience, especially when you add things like HBO-GO. However, it was very worth while.
customer_reviews.author: The Givenator

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Video didnt work on this Roku
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Prime video did not work from the day I got it. Tried EVERYTHING. Resets, reboots, reloads of the App, called amazon, called Roku absolutely no solution. No firewall problems, nothing else, ONLY from the Amazon Prime App on the Roku. I returned the Roku and bought a Fire Stick because I didnt want to spend HOURS troubleshooting it. I just wanted to relax and watch TV. Amazon won by the app not working.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Got rid of my Tivo's and I'm never looking back.
customer_reviews.text: This is the way of entertainment is going. Get a fast internet connection and stream to your hearts content. Easy interface, quick response times and gets updates very fast. I chose this version because of the Ethernet connection and the "point anywhere" remote. Didn't need the voice search of the ultra version. After trying one of these out, I sold all of my Tivo's and converted to cloud DVR and streaming services on demand. I don't think I'll ever go back.
customer_reviews.author: Baltojeff

customer_reviews.title: This one is the best one in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Fast and responsive. Supports everything I need and then some. I can tell especially by the remote that the hardware quality has improved since my last Roku, a Roku 3, and that the hardware is much more powerful than our other Roku we use with a universal remote, a Roku Express. This one is the best one in my opinion, especially if you get it on a good sale price and don't need the higher end stuff the even newer one offers.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: THE solution to cable cutting
customer_reviews.text: Bough as a gift for my mother after she decided to cut the cable. Mission accomplished! Roku's myriad of free "channels" and a Prime subscription offer more than enough programming to make up for losing cable TV. Additionally, the Roku UI is a cinch to navigate and very intuitive, definitely better than my smart TV's clunky UI and much more straightforward than a home theater PC.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: The Best Streaming Device I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: The difference between Roku and my other options for streaming (TV and home theater) is amazing. So much faster and much more reliable. I doubt that any can come close to the number of services offered by Roku. We find ourselves streaming more an watching live TV less simply because Roku makes it easier and more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L. Penza

customer_reviews.title: HDCP Issues.
customer_reviews.text: It would be great if I didn't have HDCP issues all the time. When it starts doing it I have to unplug it and reset it to get it to quit. The TV and HDMI cable all meet the standards they say you must meet to avoid the problem but it still happens. I have not had the issue with my fire stick in the bedroom. I like the user friendly display more on this than my fire stick, so I'm unsure of which device I will put in my office.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Saved me $140 a month when I got rid of DirecTV. Thought I would, but I don't miss it at all. The only issue I have with it is that the voice search locks up the unit about every other time you use it. You can either wait a few minutes for the Roku to reboot itself, or just manually reboot it (pull the power plug). Other than that, it's great. The headphones playing through the remote are surprisingly useful.
customer_reviews.author: RichardBlackwood

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from our old Roku Classic!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our old Roku Classic which had run out of gas. A few years ago we tried to upgrade to a newer player - don't remember which one - but the interface on that box was horrid so we returned it. So we were pleasantly surprised at how well this player works and how easy it is to use the interface. Also like the headphone feature! Aside from the somewhat steep price we really like this player!
customer_reviews.author: Treibs

customer_reviews.title: Device works and we love it, but the remote audio jack was inop!
customer_reviews.text: Device works and we love it, but the remote audio jack was inop. Checked with multiple headsets that are working. Nothing helps! Contacted ROKU and they indicated that I'd have to return the unit to Amazon to get it corrected. Giant pain, but it is my only path to a fully functioning unit. Tried to contact seller, but the phone contact was never successful (20 minutes). No response to email as yet. Elected to just get a replacement unit sent! Thank goodness for Amazon Prime's excellent return/replacement option! That had the problem solved in short order!
customer_reviews.author: Howard Gault

customer_reviews.title: Great Improvement upon my Roku 2
customer_reviews.text: I am upgrading from a very old Roku 2. I am loving the speed of the interface and the speed of the wifi connect using the Premiere+. I don't have as much buffering and crashing issues as with my Roku 2. I would give this a 5 star rating if they allowed to reprogram the shortcut app buttons from Hulu, SlingTV, HboNow and Netflix to other apps. For example, I have HboGo and not HboNow.
customer_reviews.author: dmcmaste

customer_reviews.title: HDCP error messages?
customer_reviews.text: I persistently get a purple screen with "HDCP unauthorized content disabled," especially when watching the YouTube app. Sometimes it flashes up for just a second, but eventually the purple screen stays up and I can't even use the "back" button to go to the main menu. I have a new Sony TV that's supposed to be compatible with all of the HDCP whatnot, but it's easier to return the $50 Roku than the $3000 TV. I've followed all of the suggested troubleshooting (basically, "your HDMI cable is defective"), but it doesn't make a difference. This was supposed to be an upgrade from my previous Roku 3 box, but the old box works better than the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Rico Suave

customer_reviews.title: I am giving it 4 stars though because I fell like the amount of "apps" could be better
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd Roku device. We finally had to replace their very first version after I believe was 6 years. I am giving it 4 stars though because I fell like the amount of "apps" could be better. There are many things I do love however. The app on your phone to control the Roku when you loose the remote. The headphone option is perfect when I wake up in the middle of the night and can't get back to sleep, so I can put something on without waking my husband!
customer_reviews.author: nanny on the run

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I paid $83.99 for this less than 6 months ago. Thought I should be able to return, but Amazon only offers phone number to call for help. That phone number is no longer valid (per message). That was a lot of money to pay for something that gives out this soon. I've tried changing batteries, got a new HDMI cable, switched to all other HDMI ports on my tv (where other devices work fine). I'm not real happy right now!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia F Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Good new Roku
customer_reviews.text: Excellent model Roku. Easy setup. Works very well, it's fast and picture in 4k is excellent. Originally screen mirroring didn't work but new firmware upgrade solved the problem. The only other problem is that the Roku Media Player app will.NOT display high resolution photos from my DSLR camera properly (4k). But that's a problem with the app. My old Roku 3 has the same problem handling high resolution photos properly.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip S. Hills

customer_reviews.title: Quick response and I love the headphone jack
customer_reviews.text: Went with the Premiere+ because I wanted the Ethernet cable option in the event I ever get around to running CAT5e cable to my TV. Using it via WiFi for now with zero issues. The Roku is much quicker in accessing Netflix, Vudu and Amazon Prime than my Vizio SmartTV. The cherry on top is the headphone jack on the remote. It works great for when I want to watch TV late at night and not disturb the rest of the family.
customer_reviews.author: Ohana of 3Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for my older TV and loved it. So when I dropped my Satellite company, I bought this to stream all kinds of companies. I have so many options. I definitely will not go back to cable or satellite companies for my tv.
customer_reviews.author: LORI448

customer_reviews.title: They work great with spectrum cable and other streaming apps
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased 4 roku’s over the past month to replace my cable boxes and HD antennas. They work great with spectrum cable and other streaming apps. The only complaint I have is that they don’t give a great desctiption between the different types of units. The biggest difference I’ve found is the the ultimate has the ability to turn your tv on and off and controlled the volume, the less expensive ones don’t do that which is a big draw back since you need to keep your tv remote on hand. I realized this after purchaing a stick them the premier (non of those remotes work with your tv) then the ultimate.
customer_reviews.author: Link

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase, it works like a charm, and the best part is that it improves the picture remarkably, it puts the HD offered by my cable company to shame, whether it's Netflix, Amazon Prime or whatever, the picture quality is top-notch. I highly recommend this product. Oh, and you can connect your headphones to the remote which is very handy at night, when you don't want to wake anybody up if the sound gets to be too loud. All in all, a great product. A big thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well
customer_reviews.text: Quick to load and respond to orders, no issues and have been fairly satisfied with the item. I wish you could easily turn it on or off rather than sleep, but power consumption is likely very low so has negligible effect. I do not know entirely (as I haven't tested), but I do believe it stops your videos when the TV shuts off (ie: sleep timer). I like it well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Your gonna need more Popcorn and good popper, if you get this.
customer_reviews.text: One small step for me, one giant step for cutting the cord(cable). I bought this model for the Ethernet plug, but have not needed it. Streams flawlessly and is the new favorite of the household. Just binged "Sneaky Pete" on Amazon Prime. Jonesin' for the the next season, now. With Prime, Netflix, Sling and Hulu I don't even watch the cable anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I'm a happy Roku customer!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get rid of my premium cable package and go to a Roku to save money. Great investment. It is saving me $100/month. The TV in my living room is not a smart TV and I wasn't able to watch Netflix, Vudu, or Amazon video on it. Now I am able to. Plus with a sling subscription I can still watch all of the cable channels that I love. And still save money. Easy to set up, user friendly apps, quick response time when channel surfing, I highly recommend Roku!
customer_reviews.author: Dolfun

customer_reviews.title: Way faster than older model Roku's
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, this works great with my Netflix and personal Plex movie library. Bought it to replace a Roku 2 that was so sluggish and slow that it had about a 2-3 second latency which was awful. This is very responsive and faster than my other Roku 3. It spends no time loading menus or switching between pages. So far it's the best personal streaming device I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: LankyFrenchman

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Roku for 5 year now and this newest one is even better. I can now login to Netflix with my account and not my family. The shows automatically go to the next episode and the picture is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Bernice

customer_reviews.title: This device gets all my preferred services and is easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Apple, Google and Amazon products fail either due to glaring omissions in their streaming offerings or just being overpriced. This device gets all my preferred services and is easy to set up. Sure it's not as powerful as a Kodi box but for something for your kids or parents the Roku is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wade

customer_reviews.title: HDCP headache
customer_reviews.text: Had issue with HDCP unauthorized. A common Roku issue. Finally got it working and now the latest pushed update makes the unit worthless again. I’m done with you Roku.
customer_reviews.author: kingalien

customer_reviews.title: TV control doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The remote doesn’t do the TV controls (volume up/down) or listen on the headphones! As it advertises that it does this I’m really disappointed because that’s the main reason I bought it, so I could listen and not disturb my husband when he’s sleeping! BUT for a mere $29 dollars more I can get yet another “Enhanced” remote that will?! I’m disappointed in the description and in Roku! UPDATE: So we have lost our Roku remote now our only option is to pay anywhere from $20 up for a new remote when we can get a whole new Roku kit for $29 I think I’m going to go out and buy me the Alexa one instead 😟
customer_reviews.author: M.Rose

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: The setup was quick and easy. The picture quality is excellent, but there is a slight delay between the sound and video. I'm unsure if it's my streaming service provider, the Roku device, or my internet service provider. The headphone jack on the remote is a nice feature but static comes through the headphones whenever the connection is touched in any way.
customer_reviews.author: M. L.

customer_reviews.title: disapponted
customer_reviews.text: after setting up our PREMIER roku we discovered it wasn't very premier. It came with a remote that had no volume control or ability to turn off our TV. I have cheaper models that have that ability and intended on replacing them with this so called premier. Well that's not happening!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon F

customer_reviews.title: Persistent HDCP errors
customer_reviews.text: Tried connecting this directly to a Sony 4K TV with three different certified premium high speed HDMI cables, but continuously encountered HDCP errors messages. Returned this for the new 2017 Ultra which works flawlessly. Would have been worth the price if I was connect it to a 1080p TV.
customer_reviews.author: IslandStyle

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work reliably for me
customer_reviews.text: The device I received had problems with the remote from day 1. It would function about 80% of the time and I don't use it that much so we kept using it in that state, kind of limping along. Finally it became too annoying to use and I just used the apps on my smart TV (poor selection of apps and slow interface but way less frustrating to use than the ROKU). A few days ago I plugged it back in, and it stopped working completely. The ROKU screen popped up but it went blank after that. I am going to try and return it for another device, possibly a ROKU with a standard IR remote and no 4K funcitonality.
customer_reviews.author: cc

product_meta.title: Roku Premiere - HD and 4K UHD Streaming Media Player with HDR
product_meta.description: Get powerful performance, stunning 4K* and HDR* picture quality, and an advanced remote for an amazing streaming experience. The new Roku Premiere+ for HD & 4K Ultra HD TVs comes with a fast quad core processor for ultra smooth streaming. Brilliant 4K resolution at 60fps immerses you in the action with crisp, life like images that practically jump off the screen. Vibrant HDR gives you rich, realistic color detail even in the darkest shadows and brightest highlights. You can watch just about anything with access to 350,000+ movies and TV episodes across 3,500+ paid or free channels. And get great features like a handy point anywhere remote with headphones for private listening. *The 4K experience requires a compatible 4K TV and 4K content. HDR requires a compatible HDR TV and HDR content. Such content will not be available on all channels. Check with the 4K channel partner for specific bandwidth requirements to access its 4K content. *TV Compatibility:HD TVs – Up to 1080p (1920 x 1080) with up scaling from 720p, 4K UHD TVs – Up to 2160p at 60fps (3840 × 2160) with up scaling from 720p and 1080p,4K UHD HDR TVs – Supports HDR10 technology.
feature_bullets: Powerful quad core processor and fast dual band wireless. 8x more processing power than before
Access to amazon, vudu, Netflix, Hulu, google play, and more
Portable for different HDTVS in your home, hotel, and dorm rooms
Unbiased search results Across top channels to find where it's free or cheapest to watch
Free mobile app for iOS and android with voice search and private listening

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,320 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
